Answer the following question based on the information in the given passage. Passage: The RAF was founded on 1 April 1918, towards the end of the First World War by merging the Royal Flying Corps and the Royal Naval Air Service.  After the war, the RAF was greatly reduced in size and during the inter-war years was used to "police" the British Empire.  The RAF underwent rapid expansion prior to and during the Second World War.  During the war it was responsible for the aerial defence of Great Britain, the strategic bombing campaign against Germany and tactical support to the British Army around the world. Question: When was the Royal Air Force established? Answer:

summary: The RAF was founded on 1 April 1918, towards the end of the First World War by merging the Royal Flying Corps and the Royal Naval Air Service.  After the war, the RAF was greatly reduced in size and during the inter-war years was used to "police" the British Empire.  The RAF underwent rapid expansion prior to and during the Second World War.  During the war it was responsible for the aerial defence of Great Britain, the strategic bombing campaign against Germany and tactical support to the British Army around the world.
question: When was the Royal Air Force established?
label: 1 April 1918
